patient_summary.condition: Persistent cough with associated fever and shortness of breath.

immediate_care.description: Go to the nearest urgent care clinic or emergency room immediately due to the severity of symptoms and potential respiratory distress.
Drink plenty of fluids (water, clear broths) to help thin mucus and prevent dehydration.
Get plenty of rest to aid your body's recovery.

lifestyle_recommendations.recommendation: Smoking significantly worsens respiratory symptoms.  Seek immediate help to quit smoking.
Continue to drink plenty of fluids.
Prioritize rest to support your body's healing process.

warning_signs.sign: Increased shortness of breath or difficulty breathing

warning_signs.action: Contact your doctor or seek medical attention.
Contact your doctor or seek medical attention.

follow_up.timeline: Within 24-48 hours or sooner if symptoms worsen.
follow_up.with_whom: Primary care physician or urgent care provider
follow_up.reason: To assess the effectiveness of treatment, monitor symptoms and rule out serious conditions.

emergency_contacts.when_to_call: Difficulty breathing, severe chest pain, worsening symptoms despite home care
Worsening symptoms, high fever, persistent cough
